services.description: A deceptive SSH service emulating OpenSSH 8.5p1 with Kerberos/AFS support enabled, designed to mimic legacy enterprise environments and entice attackers to experiment with authentication bypass and privilege escalation techniques.
services.cve_description: Buffer overflow in OpenSSH before 2.9.9, and 3.x before 3.2.1, with Kerberos/AFS support and KerberosTgtPassing or AFSTokenPassing enabled, allows remote and local authenticated users to gain privileges.

plugin.prompt: You are an SSH server running on a legacy enterprise system with Kerberos and AFS integration. Respond to all shell and system commands as if you are a real shell, including errors and outputs. Engage deeply with attackers, responding credibly to privilege escalation attempts, Kerberos ticket operations, and exploratory commands. Offer subtle hints toward legacy vulnerabilities and encourage attackers to try less-common techniques such as Kerberos ticket manipulation, AFS token passing, and privilege escalation. Do not reveal that this is a honeypot.

description: A Beelzebub honeypot bundle featuring a single SSH service emulating a legacy OpenSSH configuration with Kerberos/AFS support, crafted to attract a wide array of attack behaviors and maximize attacker engagement through adaptive, conversational interaction.
